column1: Bureau of Justice Statistics - Data Online
Reported crime in District of Columbia
Notes: When data are unavailable, the cells are blank or the year is not presented.
State offense totals are based on data from all reporting agencies and estimates for unreported areas.
Rates are the number of reported offenses per 100,000 population

Delaware - Since complete data were not available for 1995, Delaware crime counts for that year are estimates.  1998, 1999, and 2000 forcible rape figures furnished by the state-level Uniform Crime Reporting (UCR) Program administered by the Delaware State Bureau of Investigation were not in accordance with national UCR guidelines.  Therefore, the figures were excluded from the forcible rape, Crime Index total, and Modified Crime Index total categories.
District of Columbia - 1999-2002 District of Columbia data include reports from the Zoological Police.  2002 data also include reports from the Metro Transit Police.
Florida - For the State of Florida  for 1996, an aggregate  total  was supplied by the Florida Department of Law Enforcement.

Illinois - Complete data for 1993-2002 were not available for Illinois, therefore, crime counts for those years are estimates. Since the 1985-2002 forcible rape figures were not in accordance with national UCR guidelines, forcible rape totals for Illinois are estimates.
Iowa - Since data for 1991 were not available for Iowa,  crime counts for that year are estimates.
Kansas - Since complete data were not available for  1993-2000, Kansas crime counts for those years are estimates.

Kentucky - Since complete data were not available for 1988 and 1995-2002, Kentucky crime counts for those years are estimates.   Aggravated assault figures for 1994  were not in accordance with national UCR guidelines and cannot be compared to the figures in other years.
Maine - Since complete data were not available for 1999, Maine crime counts for that year are estimates.

Michigan - 1993 forcible rape figures furnished by the State-level Uniform Crime Reporting Program were not in accordance with national UCR guidelines.  Therefore, the 1993 forcible rape totals for Michigan were estimated.

Minnesota - 1993 forcible rape figures furnished by the State-level Uniform Crime Reporting Program were not in accordance with national UCR guidelines.  Therefore, 1993 forcible rape totals for Minnesota were estimated.  1999 and 2000 forcible rape figures for Minnesota are not comparable to previous years.
Montana - Since complete data were not available for 1993-2000, Montana crime counts are for those years are estimates.
New Hampshire - Complete data for 1997-99 were not available; therefore, it was necessary that New Hampshire crime counts be estimated.
Pennsylvania - Since complete data were not available 1995, Pennsylvania crime counts for that year are estimates.
Tennessee - Due to changes in reporting practices, annexations, and/or incomplete data, 2000 figures are not comparable to previous years' data.
Vermont - Since complete data were not available 1997, Vermont crime counts for that year are estimates.  1998 data are not comparable to previous years' data due to changes in reporting practices.
West Virginia - Due to changes in reporting practices, annexations, and/or incomplete data, 1999 and 2000 data for West Virginia are not comparable to earlier years.
Wisconsin - Complete data for 1998 were not available; therefore, it was necessary that Wisconsin crime counts be estimated.
The murder and nonnegligent homicides that occurred as a result of the events of September 11, 2001 are not included.
Sources: FBI, Uniform Crime Reports, prepared by the National Archive of Criminal Justice Data
